        public Budget()

    • Method Detail

      • totalPrice

        public static int totalPrice(int[] price,
                             int[] amount)
        Gets the total price of the materials by adding each material price multiplied by its amount.
        Parameters:
        price - An integer array with all the prices of each material. price != null and price != "".
        amount - An integer array with the amount needed for each material.
        Returns:
        Returns the sum of each material price multiplied by its amount.

      • bestPrice

        public static int[] bestPrice(int[] priceList1,
                              int[] priceList2,
                              int[] priceList3)
        Compares the prices from each shop and gets the best price for each material.
        Parameters:
        priceList1 - An integer array that has all the prices for each material in the first shop.
        priceList2 - An integer array that has all the prices for each material in the second shop.
        priceList3 - An integer array that has all the prices for each material in the third shop.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer array containing the best prices for each material.

      • bestPricePlace

        public static java.lang.String[] bestPricePlace(int[] bestPriceList,
                                                int[] priceList1,
                                                int[] priceList2,
                                                int[] priceList3)
        Gets the name of the shop that has the best price for each material.
        Parameters:
        bestPriceList - An integer array containing the best prices for each material.
        priceList1 - An integer array that has all the prices for each material in the first shop.
        priceList2 - An integer array that has all the prices for each material in the second shop.
        priceList3 - An integer array that has all the prices for each material in the third shop.
        Returns:
        Returns a String array with the name of the shop that has the best price for each material.

      • getFilterListSize

        public static int getFilterListSize(java.lang.String[] useList,
                                    java.lang.String filter)
        Gets the amount of materials in the category introduced.
        Parameters:
        useList - A String array that has the use of each material. useList != null.
        filter - The category the user wants to see the materials of. Valid values (Ignores case): "Obra negra", "Obra blanca", "Pintura".
        Returns:
        Returns the existing amount of materials in the use category.

      • getFilterList

        public static java.lang.String[] getFilterList(int size,
                                               java.lang.String[] materialList,
                                               java.lang.String[] useList,
                                               java.lang.String filter)
        Gets the list of the name of the materials existing in the filtered category.
        Parameters:
        size - The existing amount of materials in the use category. size != null.
        materialList - A String array with the name of each material.
        useList - A String array with the use of each material.
        filter - The category the user wants to see the materials of. Valid values (Ignores case): "Obra negra", "Obra blanca", "Pintura".
        Returns:
        Returns a String array with the existing materials of the category filter introduced.

      • getBestTotal

        public static int getBestTotal(int[] bestPriceList,
                               int[] amountList)
        Sums the best price of each material.
        Parameters:
        bestPriceList - An integer array containing the best prices for each material.
        amountList - An integer array with the amount needed for each material.
        Returns:
        Returns the sum of each material price multiplied by its amount.
